required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Applications and Influences of Transthoracic Echocardiography in Stroke Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Applications and Influences of Transthoracic Echocardiography in Stroke Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Transthoracic echocardiography (TTE) is known to be an effective modality in assessing cardiac function as well as the structure of the heart. It was estimated that between 15% and 30% of ischemic strokes were due to a cardioembolic source, Therefore, TTE has been assumed as an important screening tool in patients with ischemic stroke, as atrial fibrillation is one of the leading risk factors. However, current guidelines have little evidence in whether performing TTE can alter clinical management and prevent a future stroke. We aim to present the association of performing TTE and clinical outcomes in stroke patients.

primary_outcome.description: the correlation between the echocardiography and recurrence of stroke

clinical_study.condition: the Impact of Echocardiography on the Recurrence of Stroke

study_pop.textblock: patients with acute stroke and receiving echocardiography

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with acute stroke and receiving echocardiography
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with acute stroke and not receiving echocardiography

facility.name: Department of Emergency Medicine, National Taiwan University Hospital
